title: Programming Exercise Rubric: Reading CSV and Storing Data in a Dictionary
description: This rubric assesses the correctness and quality of the Python code written to read from the 'temperatures.csv' file and store the specified columns in a dictionary named 'temps'. Each criterion is weighted based on its importance to the overall functionality and reliability of the solution.

criteria.title: Importing the CSV Module
criteria.description: Correctly imports the `csv` module required for handling CSV files.

criteria.title: Defining the 'temps' Dictionary
criteria.description: Initializes `temps` as an empty dictionary before populating it with data.

criteria.title: Opening the File Correctly
criteria.description: Opens 'temperatures.csv' in read mode (`'r'`) without unnecessary parameters, ensuring the file is accessible for reading.

criteria.title: Setting Up csv.reader Properly
criteria.description: Initializes `csv.reader` with the opened file object to correctly parse the CSV data.

criteria.title: Skipping the Header Row
criteria.description: Uses `next(reader)` to skip the header row, preventing header data from being processed as actual data.

criteria.title: Iterating Over CSV Rows Correctly
criteria.description: Correctly iterates through each row of the CSV file after the header, ensuring all data rows are processed.

criteria.title: Accessing Correct Columns
criteria.description: Accurately accesses the first (`Date`) and third (`Sensor2`) columns in each row using appropriate indexing.

criteria.title: Casting Sensor2 Values to Float
criteria.description: Properly casts the `Sensor2` values to `float` to ensure numerical operations can be performed on the data.

criteria.title: Storing Data in 'temps' Dictionary
criteria.description: Stores the `Date` as the key and the corresponding `Sensor2` float value as the value in the `temps` dictionary correctly.

criteria.title: Closing the File
criteria.description: Closes the file after processing to free up system resources and avoid potential file corruption.
